item.title: Resident scene fly tips a large trolley full of household items.also fly tipped the trolley after he finished in the public bins at Mallard close E9 5JL block of flats on 18/05/25 at 19:09pm. Resident walking with the shopping trolley from his home address in the Daintry Way E9 5JJ area all the way down Osborne Road to Mallard close block bins to fly tip. Resident Regularly fly tips around the whole Trowbridge estate. Is unfair on residence to have to put up with this anti-social behavior. Someone from Hackney Council could please look into this and investigate to put a stop to this fly tipping behavior. His behaviour is not fair on the residents,hackney Council cleaning teams. Hackney Council have to pay the cleanup cost due to this residence behavior., 28th June
item.description:
Residence fly tipping in Mallard close E9 5JL public bins block of flats. Antisocial behaviour.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mallard Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flyposting/Stickers, 28th June
item.description:
Just to inform you, there is currently a big problem with these stickers (see attached picture) being stuck ALL OVER THE PLACE along the High Street. From the war memorial all the way through to the green. On every street sign, traffic light, ped xing, bus stop, metal bike rack holder, drain pipes, TFL cabinets, walls etc...Almost everything was tagged with these stickers. I spent at least an hour walking along the High Street early this morning trying to locate and remove as many as possible. Can you please inform your cleaning staff to be on the look out for these stickers so it can be stopped before it gets completely out of control. Chances are Bromley might have the same problem too so it might be a good idea to inform cleaners around that shopping area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 199-203, High Street, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned road works, 28th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 53, Brockley Rise, Honor Oak, London

item.title: Garden Rubbish Tipped in Park, 28th June
item.description:
A large pile of hedge cuttings from outside 1A Seymour Terrace and a cordyline tree from their front garden have been dumped across the fence into Betts Park, together with an old rug and estate agent board.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 50, Seymour Villas, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet
